intro: Chamaegeron keredjensis, commonly known as the Keredj bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
